com.samskivert.swing.util
Class SwingUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.samskivert.swing.util.SwingUtil

public class SwingUtil
extends Object

Miscellaneous useful Swing-related utility functions.

Nested Class Summary
static interface SwingUtil.ComponentOp
          An operation that may be applied to a component.
static interface SwingUtil.DocumentTransformer
          An interface for transforming the text contained within a document.
static interface SwingUtil.DocumentValidator
          An interface for validating the text contained within a document.

Method Detail

centerWindow

public static void centerWindow(Window window)
Center the given window within the screen boundaries.

Parameters:
window - the window to be centered.

centerComponent

public static void centerComponent(Component a,
                                   Component b)
Centers component b within component a.

drawStringCentered

public static void drawStringCentered(Graphics g,
                                      String str,
                                      int x,
                                      int y,
                                      int width,
                                      int height)
Draw a string centered within a rectangle. The string is drawn using the graphics context's current font and color.

Parameters:
g - the graphics context.
str - the string.
x - the bounding x position.
y - the bounding y position.
width - the bounding width.
height - the bounding height.

fitRectInRect

public static Point fitRectInRect(Rectangle rect,
                                  Rectangle bounds)
Returns the most reasonable position for the specified rectangle to be placed at so as to maximize its containment by the specified bounding rectangle while still placing it as near its original coordinates as possible.

Parameters:
rect - the rectangle to be positioned.
bounds - the containing rectangle.

positionRect

public static boolean positionRect(Rectangle r,
                                   Rectangle bounds,
                                   Collection<? extends Shape> avoidShapes)
Position the specified rectangle as closely as possible to its current position, but make sure it is within the specified bounds and that it does not overlap any of the Shapes contained in the avoid list.

Parameters:
r - the rectangle to attempt to position.
bounds - the bounding box within which the rectangle must be positioned.
avoidShapes - a collection of Shapes that must not be overlapped. The collection will be destructively modified.
Returns:
true if the rectangle was successfully placed, given the constraints, or false if the positioning failed (the rectangle will be left at it's original location.

createPointComparator

public static <P extends Point2D> Comparator<P> createPointComparator(P origin)
Create a comparator that compares against the distance from the specified point. Note: The comparator will continue to sort by distance from the origin point, even if the origin point's coordinates are modified after the comparator is created. Used by positionRect().

setEnabled

public static void setEnabled(Container comp,
                              boolean enabled)
Enables (or disables) the specified component, and all of its children. A simple call to Component.setEnabled(boolean) does not propagate the enabled state to the children of a component, which is senseless in our opinion, but was surely done for some arguably good reason.

setOpaque

public static void setOpaque(JComponent comp,
                             boolean opaque)
Set the opacity on the specified component, and all of its children.

applyToHierarchy

public static void applyToHierarchy(Component comp,
                                    SwingUtil.ComponentOp op)
Apply the specified ComponentOp to the supplied component and then all its descendants.

applyToHierarchy

public static void applyToHierarchy(Component comp,
                                    int depth,
                                    SwingUtil.ComponentOp op)
Apply the specified ComponentOp to the supplied component and then all its descendants, up to the specified maximum depth.

setDocumentHelpers

public static void setDocumentHelpers(JTextComponent comp,
                                      SwingUtil.DocumentValidator validator,
                                      SwingUtil.DocumentTransformer transformer)
Set active Document helpers on the specified text component. Changes will not and cannot be made (either via user inputs or direct method manipulation) unless the validator says that the changes are ok.

Parameters:
validator - if non-null, all changes are sent to this for approval.
transformer - if non-null, is queried to change the text after all changes are made.

setDocumentHelpers

public static void setDocumentHelpers(Document doc,
                                      SwingUtil.DocumentValidator validator,
                                      SwingUtil.DocumentTransformer transformer)
Set active Document helpers on the specified Document. Changes will not and cannot be made (either via user inputs or direct method manipulation) unless the validator says that the changes are ok.

Parameters:
validator - if non-null, all changes are sent to this for approval.
transformer - if non-null, is queried to change the text after all changes are made.

activateAntiAliasing

public static Object activateAntiAliasing(Graphics2D gfx)
Activates anti-aliasing in the supplied graphics context on both text and 2D drawing primitives.

Returns:
an object that should be passed to restoreAntiAliasing(java.awt.Graphics2D, java.lang.Object) to restore the graphics context to its original settings.

restoreAntiAliasing

public static void restoreAntiAliasing(Graphics2D gfx,
                                       Object rock)
Restores anti-aliasing in the supplied graphics context to its original setting.

Parameters:
rock - the results of a previous call to activateAntiAliasing(java.awt.Graphics2D) or null, in which case this method will NOOP. This alleviates every caller having to conditionally avoid calling restore if they chose not to activate earlier.

getDefaultTextAntialiasing

public static boolean getDefaultTextAntialiasing()
Returns true if anti-aliasing is desired by default. This currently checks the value of the swing.aatext property, but will someday switch to using Java Desktop Properties which in theory get their values from OS preferences.

sizeToContents

public static void sizeToContents(JTable table)
Adjusts the widths and heights of the cells of the supplied table to fit their contents.

refresh

public static void refresh(JComponent c)
Refreshes the supplied JComponent to effect a call to JComponent.revalidate() and JComponent.repaint(long, int, int, int, int), which is frequently necessary in cases such as adding components to or removing components from a JPanel since Swing doesn't automatically invalidate things for proper re-rendering.

createImageCursor

public static Cursor createImageCursor(Image img)
Create a custom cursor out of the specified image, putting the hotspot in the exact center of the created cursor.

createImageCursor

public static Cursor createImageCursor(Image img,
                                       Point hotspot)
Create a custom cursor out of the specified image, with the specified hotspot.

addDebugBorders

public static void addDebugBorders(JPanel panel)
Adds a one pixel border of random color to this and all panels contained in this panel's child hierarchy.

setFrameIcons

public static void setFrameIcons(Frame frame,
                                 List<? extends Image> icons)
Sets the frame's icons. Unfortunately, the ability to pass multiple icons so the OS can choose the most size-appropriate one was added in 1.6; before that, you can only set one icon. This method attempts to find and use setIconImages, but if it can't, sets the frame's icon to the first image in the list passed in.

makeCompactGrid

public static void makeCompactGrid(Container parent,
                                   int rows,
                                   int cols,
                                   int initialX,
                                   int initialY,
                                   int xPad,
                                   int yPad)
Aligns the first rows * cols components of parent in a grid. Each component in a column is as wide as the maximum preferred width of the components in that column; height is similarly determined for each row. The parent is made just big enough to fit them all. The components should be already added to the parent in row-major order.

Parameters:
parent - the container component; must be configured with a SpringLayout prior to calling this method.
rows - number of rows.
cols - number of columns.
initialX - x location at which to start the grid.
initialY - y location at which to start the grid.
xPad - x padding between cells.
yPad - y padding between cells.
